Entry.2: Brigade Sports (Horse event) at Tripoli fine day, big crowd of spectators Events well contested Everything went with a bang.
Entry.3:
​Foot events today.
Another fine & successful day.
Entry.11:
Left Tripoli Camp 6 am embarked on SS Tagus en route to Cairo on leave. Sailed at about 11 am. Arrived Beyrout abt 3.30 pm. Lovely trip. Pretty town. Left Beyrout abt 5 pm.

20
19 Wednesday
​ February
Fine trip, beautiful weather arrived Port Said 1 pm. Port very busy, arrivals & departures. SS Canberra & Port Sydney in port. Transport arrived from France en route to Dussel. Left port Said 6.10 pm, arrived Cairo 11.15. Stayed at Cecil House.
Entry.13:
Out to Kit Stores afternoon.
Pictures at night.
Entry.14:
Ghezirah races, had a good day.
Out to Heliopolis for dinner
Entry.15:
Hospital afternoon.
Casino de Paris at night.
Entry.18:
Went to the E.E.F.Sports (heats).
Dinner at Heliopolis
Entry.19:
Motoring to Barrage.
Kursaal at night.
Earl & the Girl.
Entry.20: Heliopolis 5 pm. Stayed for dinner. Motored home
Entry.21:
Hospital afternoon.
Heliopolis for dinner.
Motored to Opera House - Cairo & to French Drama, Les Martyrs.
Entry.22: Left Cairo 7 am train, arrived Port Said 12.30. Regiment on its way to Moascar where we rejoin it tomorrow.
Entry.23:
Visited H.M.S. New Zealand in Port Said. Went aboard had a look over her.
Rained in afternoon.
Left Port Said 6.10 pm arrived Moascar 8.45 pm.
Entry.24:
Moascar.
Very windy & dusty day, light showers in afternoon.
S.P. Tonight.
Entry.26:
Malaria still.
Regt arrived here at 2 pm.
Entry.28: OK today - except a bit shaky.
Entry.30: 3rd Brigade on strike against 2 hours drill from 9.30 am till 11.30 am. The whole brigade stuck like one man.
Entry.31:
Drill cut out after breakfast.
Started French today.
We got everything we asked for.
Entry.32: With Dick Jupp & G Tait tonight.
Entry.33: Cairo riots broke out. Very serioous trouble there. May mean that we will have to stay longer here.
Entry.35: Genl Ryrie addressed the Brigade. Some of the Regt went up towards Cairo to quell riot.
Entry.36: Very windy today & very dusty & sandy
Entry.37: More of the Regt went to Zag-a-Zig - trouble up there.
Entry.38:
17
March
All the Reg't packed up & moved on towards Zag-a-Zig.
Block on the line about 5 miles before Zag a Zig. Line & sleepers pulled up before & after a bridge. Telegraph wires cut. Delayed about 3 hours.
Arrived Zag a Zig 8 pm. TroopC" Sqdn went out. Met some Arabs tearing up line. Sgt J Mathieson killed by bullet.

Tuesday, 19 
18
​
Entry.39:
Remainder of Brigade marched thro Zag a Zig, fixed bayonets & loaded rifles.
Sgt Mathieson buried at 4 pm. Several wreaths came from English Civilians. Self & three others came up line abt 8 Kilos from Zag a Zig guarding a bridge - all quiet.

Wednesday, 20 
19
Entry.40:
Still on guard at the bridge.
Relieved by 1 NCO & 6 men at 5.15.
Commandered a garry & niggers to go back to Zag a Zig. Arrived 6.30. J Ferguson & 3 men attacked by a mob. 2 escaped back to Camp. Party went out to find Ferguson & Brown. Both badly smashed. Ferguson died during the night.

Thursday, 21 
20
​
Entry.41:
Ferguson died this morning.
Left Zagazig on train escort 2 pm,arrived Kantara 7.30 pm. Camped on train (trucks). Rode on engine - got black.
Entry.42:
21
 March
Left Kantara at daylight, arrived Port Said 8.15 am. Went to Rest Camp.Had good wash & change etc.
Left Port Said 3.15, arrived Ismailia 7 pm.
Camped on station.


Saturday, 23 
22
​
Entry.43:
Left Ismailia 5.30 am on goods train. Very dreary trip, arrived Zag a Zig 3 pm. Went back to camp.

Sunday, 24 
23
​ March
Entry.44: On guard main bridge Zag a Zig from 4 pm.
Entry.45:
​Off guard 4 pm.
Gyppos very quiet & subdued.
Entry.46: Severe attack of Malaria just after dinner.
Entry.47: Not too good this morning. Worse this afternoon. Dr sends me to Field Amb.
Entry.48:
In F.A. Zagazig.
Very off colour.
Entry.49:
Evacuated to 14th AGH today.
Arrived Cairo 3 pm.
Entry.50:
Hospital Ward B1.
Got the Quinine needle today.
Entry.54: Hips very sore today as result of the needles.
Entry.55:
Right hip inflamed, back to bed again.
Few letters arrived today.
Entry.56:
Still in bed.
Dave, Madame & Helen came to see me today. All very well.
Dave leaving for Syria Monday. I will not see him again until his return.
Entry.57:
Board Papers made out today.
Australia in sight.
Entry.59:
Boarded for Australia today whilst in bed. Cot Case so far.
Improving rapidly.
Got up today.
Entry.61: Boarded again - this time at Board Room & marked Hammock Case. Will get home more quickly this way owing to scarcity of Hospital Ships. Tramp steamer would do me to get out of this place.
Entry.65: Drew Kit etc today & warned for embarkation to leave tomorrow. Got leave. Came to Cairo, met Bluntscher & Driver at Groppis. Went to Pictures, Ct of Monte Christo. Said Good Bye - Gisele coming to Station tomorrow.
Entry.66:
Left 14th A.G.H. 7 am for Port Said en route to Australia. Gisele Barnes & friend came to Station to see me off.
Uneventful trip to P. Said.
Leave pass given to us.

Wednesday,16 April
Entry.67: have to wait some time for a boat. Previous party still here awaiting the Warwickshire.
Entry.68:
Went for a sail this morning.
Was rowed up to see the German U boats - now possessed by Japanese - only one in, rest left yesterday.
Entry.69:
Osterley in Port Said. Went aboard. Met W. Wilson (Orsova) also Joe Dixon (1st I.C.C.).
Concert tonight by "D Mobs" only passable.
Entry.70:
Nothing doing.
Port Said very monotonous.
Bored stiff
.
Went out to Cemetery with Bill Harrison.
Entry.71: Went to Mass at 10 am. Church at night.
Entry.72: Public Holiday in Port Said. Civilians enjoyed themselves on the beach.
Entry.76: Anzac Day.Concert by the Whiz Bangs tonight.
Entry.77: S.S. Wyreema in port. Also Castalia. Met Norb Jordan. Went down to the Wyreema with him, then to Castalia.
Entry.78: S S Marama arrived from NZ & Singapore en route to England.
Entry.79: After 14 days waiting we are to go aboard "Dorset" tomorrow which has been fitted up as Transport. A.I.F. Staff went aboard today - but from previous experience none of us expect anything to be done. We are not impressed with look of "Dorset". She has only one deck (fore & aft - none amidships). They have been over 14 days fitting her up.
Entry.80: Lunch at rest camp at 10.30 of awful stew badly cooked. Had roll calls five times before leaving camp, another one at the jetty. Boarded lighter at 12, got aboard about 1 & moved out at 2.10 pm. Previous impressions realised. She is very poorly fitted up & staff inefficient. Cooks had to be found from the invalids. Cooks Galley empty - no pots pans ladles or utensils of any kind. Officers in saloon as expected. 6 pm & no meal, everyone famishing. Tea arrived at 9 pm. Dry bread & cheese. Cook had trouble to even get dry tea . Repatriation men coming aboard Kantana . Bully & Biscuits sighted.
Entry.81:
Improvement in food. Better things promised.
Steaming through the canal.
Entry.86: Weather continues hot. Sea very calm.
Entry.87:
Sports today.
Concert tonight.
Presentation of prizes.
Entry.88:
Passed Island of Minikoi .
Expect to be in Colombo tomorrow night.
Entry.89:
Sports postponed - as crew were busy preparing for coaling at Colombo.
Arrived Colombo 12 MN, pulled inside breakwater & anchored. Very dull sky looks like rain.
Hottest day since leaving Egypt.
Entry.90: Colombo, morning dawned wet. We are to have leave. Left ship 10 am. Very showery. Went for car tour round Colombo, also to Mt Lavinia. Did some purchasing. Went back to ship 6 pm. Rained during night. Very muggy. Officers & nurses stopped ashore.
Entry.91:
Off & Sisters again on leave all day till 6 pm. Other ranks not allowed ashore. Coaling & watering all day. Tp. McKay not allowed ashore to see his sister so she came aboard. Guard & picket who were on duty yesterday & promised leave today not allowed ashore. Everyone dissatisfied with unfair treatment of officers in charge of us.
Left Colombo 10.30 pm.

14th
Civ. J Burns (agitator) taken on board put in cells.
Entry.92:
Fine day. Steamer going well. Dissatisfaction amongst troops on board. Brig Genl Grant O.C. troops very much disliked.
I resigned Sec of Sports at meeting tonight.
Entry.94:
Fine day but hot.
Sports this afternoon, also a good concert at night. Number of men misunderstood concert partys motives in having Stage on 3 Hatch. Tried to count them out. Concert proceeded & got great reception . A good concert.
Entry.95: Influenza broken out on board, forard deck isolated for patients mostly crew. Sgts object to isolation being above their mess. Have paraded for it to be placed aft. Hardly any stokers left. Calling for volunteers @ 5/- shift of 4 hours. Speed of tub reduced.
Entry.96:
More cases - mostly crew. Speed still reduced. Still want more stokers. Sports postponed on account of sickness. Squally weather with some rain. Heavy swell on.
Showery tonight.
Entry.97: Canvas awning removed. Flue patients lying on the deck in the sun. Squally weather continues, some more rain. Patients carried down aft on main deck. Patients again removed to hospital below main deck. More stokers wanted. Offering 2 men 1 shovel (same pay 5/- shift). Many volunteered. Dull & showery. Heavy swell still on. Tub lifting to 8 feet.
Entry.98:
Hospital full - balance of patients on aft deck.
Very heavy ground swell - ship rolling like a tub.
Entry.99:
Sports this afternoon.
Went up on the bridge. Skipper explained compass etc & few points of navigation.
Entry.100:
Quiet day - & trip very monotonous.
Soldiers still stoking.
Officers smoke room converted into hospital. Couple of officers down with flu.
Entry.101:
One of crew (O'Brien) died this morning of Pneumonia & was buried at sea.
Food very much off. Shortage of bread - but cooks & bakers are selling cakes & buns 8 for 1/-.
Discontent amongst the men. Officers dont bother to stop the cause of the discontent.
Entry.102: Much cooler this morning. Men still stoking. Ship making better headway.
Entry.103:
Sports today.
Heavy swell still on.
Entry.104:
Swell not so great.
Freemantle expected tomorrow.
Entry.105:
Another death of crew this morning buried at sea.
Rottnest Island sighted, 3 pm. All WA boys very excited. Probability of them not getting off till tomorrow.
Arrived Fremantle 6 pm anchored outside.
Vessel quarantined.
Sent wire home & to Jeanne.
I won the 1st prize for Essay on Experiences in the field.
Entry.106:
Another of crew died this morning. Body sent ashore.
Quarantine officer examined everyone on board. All hospital patients taken off about 10 am. All the WA boys left at 2 pm.
We left Fremantle 3 pm very calm.
Lot of fruit came aboard.
Q. Off. says Dorset is very dirty.
Entry.107:
Covered 215 miles average 10 - 24.
Strong following gale & heavy sea.
Entry.108:
Covered 266.3 m, average 11.11.
Strong gale & following sea.
No sports on account of rain.
Entry.110:
Very cold day.
​Sports today & fancy dress parade.
I won 1st prize for best costume - Turkish Lady.
Entry.112:
Arrived Adelaide 1.30 am. Boys went ashore at 12 noon. We did not go into the Port.
I got 2 wires.
We left again at 2 pm same day.
Entry.114:
Travelling along the Coast all the way.
Beautiful day.
Entered Port Phillip heads about 11 am, anchored 11.30 off Quarantine.
Victorians went ashore. We left again at 3.45.
Entry.115:
Beautiful day.
Sea calm as a mill pond.
Entry.116:
Beautiful day.
Passing S. Coast.
Coogee, Bondi sighted at 6 pm.
Arrived & dropped anchor at 8 pm in Quarantine.
Sydney.
Entry.117:
Leaving ship today.
Landed quarantine 3 pm.
Long walk up hill to our tent.
Entry.118:
Quarantine.
Went fishing, got mafisch.
​Rang up Jeanne & Kath but missed.
Entry.119:
​Got Jeanne on phone - very excited.
Left quarantine 2.25, picked up.
Qlands on the Dorset.
Home at last.
Entry.121:
Introducing Mr. Fell (late A.I.F).

The Honorable
Daniel Levy,
Speaker
The Speaker's Room.
Parliament House.
Entry.123:
Mrs. R. V. Fell
"Valene"
37 Derwent St.
Glebe
Entry.125:
Red Cross Home Bathurst
Billiard Tournament between VADs.
Intensely interested, enjoyed it thoroughly.
